title: website: make community resources more available
body:
http://golang.org/help/ leaves a lot to be desired. It is hard to see at a glance where I should be getting what kind of help (and also why is the playground the second link?. The FAQ—the top link—is also not close to comprehensive (but that's a separate issue).)

The page should be re-designed to link prominently to (not sure about order):
- Stack Overflow
- golang-nuts
- gophers.slack.com
- #go-nuts
- Reddit
- Go User Groups
- The Go+ community (on Google+
- Twitter?
- Go on Google+?

We should also consider linking to these resources on the front page, but I'd rather get the help page sorted out first.
